Class TaskWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window

            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • tasklist.TaskWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TaskWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  TaskWindow.TaskComparatorByPriority
      Represents a class that will implement the Comparator interface to enable the program to compare two Task objects by a given parameter
      (package private) class  TaskWindow.taskHandler
      Represents the class taskHander that inherits all the methods from MouseAdapter and will be used to "listen" for when the user clicks on a task in our table
      class  TaskWindow.TaskTableModel
      Represents the class TaskTableModel which will contain all methods included in DefaultTableModel and implements the TableModel interface - this will be used as our model for the JTable placed in our program's frame

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.JFrame

        javax.swing.JFrame.AccessibleJFrame

      Represents the default serial version ID for this class
      private TaskWindow.TaskComparatorByPriority sortComparator
      Represents a TaskComparatorByPriority object that will be used to compare the priorities of Task objects in order to sort those Tasks accordingly in the table

      Represents a table for the values to be listed within
      private TaskWindow.TaskTableModel tableModel
      Represents the table model that will be used to set certain conditions on the JTable

      Represents the panel on which the table will be displayed

      Represents the text field in which a task description will be entered

      Represents the array list that will hold the Task objects to be put on the table

      Represents the label for the Task entry field

      Represents the panel on which the buttons, labels and task fields will be held
